profile.name: Hicham Alaoui
profile.headline: Transforming Market Data into Alpha with Machine Learning.
profile.subline: Data Scientist passionate about AI and applied machine learning. I build end-to-end solutions—from data pipelines to model deployment—turning complex data into reliable, measurable outcomes.

bullets: Partner with Structuring to design, build, and maintain equity/derivatives index methodologies; translate product specs into robust operational processes.
Own monthly/quarterly index rebalancing workflows and delivery, coordinating with external calculation agents (e.g., S&P, Solactive) to meet production deadlines.
Lead daily pricing/parameter validation (Call/Put prices, key Greeks) and investigate mismatches; align fixes with trading/structuring stakeholders to protect pricing integrity.
Industrialize index production: automate controls and reporting (cross-check emails, workflow steps), standardize multi-index output formats, and streamline Bloomberg data retrieval + ESG mapping.
Maintain high traceability and documentation (Obsidian/internal artifacts) to ensure audit-ready processes and smooth handovers.
Designed a Peaks-over-Threshold EVT engine to calibrate dynamic pre-trade limits (size/price) on equity markets.
Built Python + SQL pipelines to ingest trading-access logs and 'bypasser' events into clean, analytics-ready tables.
Developed Streamlit dashboards for limit monitoring, fat-tail backtests, and Kupiec-style exception diagnostics.
Industrialized the stack with containerization and CI/CD (Docker, GitHub Actions) to keep risk tools reproducible.
Built CO₂ emissions prediction models for Swiss agriculture from multi-source time series and panel data.
Implemented an LSTM-based French article generator producing sustainability briefs for the website.
Packaged models into a lightweight Python API for scenario exploration.
Cleaned and migrated household survey microdata into PostgreSQL for poverty and welfare analysis.
Produced ARIMA/ARDL-based indicators and dashboards on poverty and labour-market dynamics.

projects.title: Dynamic Limits – EVT Risk Dashboard
projects.summary: Internal POC for dynamic pre-trade limits calibration using Peaks-over-Threshold EVT and historical trading data.
projects.problem: Static pre-trade limits failed to capture intraday volatility spikes.
projects.approach: Designed a Peaks-over-Threshold Extreme Value Theory engine to calibrate size/price limits dynamically.
projects.results: Reduced false alarms by 40% while maintaining safety coverage during varied market regimes.

projects.title: XGBoost Trading Signals
projects.summary: Research code for short-horizon equity signal generation using engineered features and walk-forward validation.
projects.problem: Capturing short-term alpha from high-frequency order book data is noisy and prone to overfitting.
projects.approach: Developed an ML pipeline using XGBoost on order book imbalance features, volatility regimes, and calendar effects.
projects.results: Achieved 62% directional accuracy out-of-sample for short-term price movements.

projects.title: FarmVision – Crop Stress Detection
projects.summary: Image-based detection of leaf stress and disease for controlled-environment agriculture using transfer learning.
projects.problem: Early detection of crop diseases is manual, slow, and prone to human error.
projects.approach: Fine-tuned ResNet50 CNNs for leaf image classification, optimized for edge deployment.
projects.results: Real-time monitoring capability with 95% recall, enabling early intervention.

projects.title: CO₂ Emissions Explorer
projects.summary: Econometric and ML models for agricultural emissions, with decomposition by sub-sector and scenario analysis.
projects.problem: Lack of granular forecast models for Swiss agricultural emissions limited policy effectiveness.
projects.approach: Built ARIMA and ARDL time-series models on panel data to isolate key drivers.
projects.results: Identified livestock and fertilizer as key drivers, directly informing NGO policy strategy.

certifications.name: Ask Questions to Make Data-Driven Decisions

education.degree: Engineering – Applied Economics, Statistics & Big Data
